channel.title: I need a coder
channel.description:
I need some codeing help ok see......i got alot of question's but for now i am only going to ask when i logg onto my server it says IN THE TOP OF THE CLIENT SCREEN i play on it says put your server name here.....i want to chang that too my server name i know it isen't my client but it's the server how do i chang this? can some-one please help me with this i am trying to make a server but for now i am a starter coder but yea......please someone help me.....post a comment on the bottom of this text thank-you :)
-me last night trying to code- = ( :confused:- :mad:- :eek:- :|- :confused:)

item.title: I need a coder
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Nobody will just randomly make a server for you, if they would it would be for money which is against the rules.

Just learn a programming language and make one yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a coder
item.dc:creator: @Realm_of_Dark Realm of Dark
item.description:
@Realm_of_Dark wrote:

Try learning Java first (there are MANY, MANY tutorials around the web). Once you know the programming language, you can go along learning how Mopar clients and servers work. You can start by doing simple edits (like the name of the client on the Frame and more), and go on to more and more (like editing models :D).

I suggest you work with a 317 first because they are the easiest to program with, and you get the most satisfaction with the least amount of time. Once you get good at 317’s, you can start looking into getting a blank 508 client (or later if they come out with one) and doing major editing on that. That’s the approach I took, and I’m currently working on a Java decompiler that doesn’t error out on my 508 HD client :mad:.

Anyways, best of luck to you. It may look tough, but knowing Java first is a big advantage in the long run.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a coder
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

codex2009:

thankyou can how do you do it though?

Its not that we can, its that we know how from time. Over time everybody can learn how to program, some faster than others. I just downloaded a server and client one day, and started playing with it and seeing what did what, try doing that.
